Corollary (Heaviside’sInversionFormula)AssumethatP(s) Q(s)hasan inverseLaplacetransformandthat Q(s)=(s�↵1)(s�↵2)···(s�↵n)hasnorepeatedfactors. Letrk,k=1,2,...,n,betheresidueofP(s) Q(s)atthepole s=↵k.Then L�1P(s) Q(s) � =r1e↵1t+r2e↵2t+···+rne↵nt. Hence L�1 1 (s+1)(s+2) � =1·e�t�1·e�2t=e�t�e�2t. TSF-INVERSETRANSFORMS MATH2014:MATHEMATICSII(Engineering) STABILITY Deﬁnition AninverseLaplacetransformissaidtobestableif L�1[F(s)]�!0ast�!1. Question WhataretheconditionsforstabilityofaninverseLaplace transform? Theorem L�1[F(s)]isstablei↵everypoleofF(s)liestotheleftofthe imaginaryaxisinthecomplexplane(i.e.,hasanegativereal part). TSF-INVERSETRANSFORMS MATH2014:MATHEMATICSII(Engineering) Proof NotefromthetheoremabovethatifaLaplacetransformF(s) hasapoleats=a+ib,thenL�1[F(s)]involves eat+ibt⇥p(t), wherep(t)isapolynomialint.Thisiseat·eibt⇥p(t).Since |eibt|=1,thebehaviourofeat·eibt⇥p(t)dependsonlyon thesignofaaseatdominatesp(t)unlessa=0.The expressionwilltendtozeroifa<0andto1ifa>0. Herepolesareat1�iand1+i.Re(1�i)=1and Re(1+i)=1>0.Therefore,inverseLaplacetransform isNOTstable. TSF-INVERSETRANSFORMS MATH2014:MATHEMATICSII(Engineering)
